pros: Administration truly cares about each employee. Many opportunities for professional and spiritual growth throughout the work week.
cons: Staffing issues create extra workloads for many staff.

pros: Learned a lot of challenging marketing strategies
Met and worked with some talented colleagues.
cons: Horrible pay, zero growth/development opportunities, top down leadership that micromanages every second of every day, love to market a certain culture but do not live it. All about revenue with little care about anything else. Sad lie of an institution.

pros: easy to use compare to other
cons: linkedin and other sites it is best

review_title: Great Mission, not so great work life
pros: 8% match on your 401K, free tuition for Bachelors Degree....must stay 1 year post grad, 50% tuition for Masters...must stay for 2 years post grad. 5.53 hours of PTO accumulate for every pay period.
cons:
A lot of people are in jobs they are highly unqualified for because they were given the position through an internal relationship. 
Collaboration and communication fall short due to poor leadership and the established culture.
Hard to move up the ladder if you are not Catholic.

job_title: Student Involvement Coordinator in Bismarck, ND
pros:
Very positive work culture. The community of individuals is fantastic. 
Definitely the best truly Catholic University I have encountered.
If anything you will feel highly fulfilled by the work you do here.
cons:
Not much room for growth upward

Shared governance could use big improvement. Most major decisions are made by a small group of 3 / 4 individuals without consulting the people that the decisions effect.

pros: The faculty are incredibly dedicated. The sisters who created the university are wonderful and warm. The benefits are decent.
cons: The place is becoming extremely conservative. You get the feeling that if you aren't Catholic, you aren't really welcome. This is completely due to the current administration. The more recent hires are equally conservative and have the attitude that if you disagree with them, you are wrong. No room for debate and no one wants to hear a different opinion, which is pretty much the opposite of what a university should be. Faculty and staff appreciate each other, but both groups share the feeling that administration views them as troublemakers. You can make more money for less work at the state schools (less work as measured by number of courses taught).

pros: Benedictine hospitality is everywhere.  Flexible schedule, employees are encouraged to grow professionally and spiritually. Great tuition benefit
cons: Some departments appear under staffed with the growth that is projected.

review_title: Great employer. Refused offers to stay here.
pros: No better place to work. Great people. Great support. Students are great.
cons: Salary is kind of low just like any other educational institution.

job_title: Student Success Advisor in Bismarck, ND
cons: benefits and pay could be better

pros: Working with nursing students is great

pros: flexibility, catholic environment, interest of the students
